qas.question: Do i need a vaccine to visit liberia?

answers.text: Travellers 18 years and above must show proof of full COVID-19 vaccination upon arrival and before departure

qas.question: How long is a negative pcr valid before flying to liberia?

answers.text: Your test must be conducted a maximum of 72 hours before departure to Liberia

paragraphs.context: Travellers 18 years and above must show proof of full COVID-19 vaccination upon arrival and before departure. Liberia recognises the following vaccines: Janssen/JJ, Pfizer-BioNTech; Moderna; AstraZeneca; Covaxin; Covishield; BIBP/Sinopharm; Sinovac. Before travelling to Liberia, you must have a negative COVID-19 PCR test result from an accredited lab, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status. Your test must be conducted a maximum of 72 hours before departure to Liberia. Before arrival in Liberia, you must download the Lib Travel mobile app from Android Play or the Apple Store. If you have problems with the app, staff at Roberts International Airport can assist you
